meanings.definition: To dub again, especially to replace a soundtrack in a film or video.
meanings.sent1: After the movie was finished, they redubbed the voices to make them clearer.
meanings.sent2: The studio is redubbing the entire film to fix the audio issues.
meanings.sent3: The redubbing process made the characters sound like they were in a different movie.
meanings.sent4: Redubbing the soundtrack was like giving the film a new voice.
meanings.sent5: The redubbing of the dialogue transformed the movie into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of adding new dialogue or sound effects to a previously recorded audio or video.
meanings.sent1: The redubbing of sound effects made the scene more exciting.
meanings.sent2: Redubbing can enhance the viewer's experience by adding new voices.
meanings.sent3: The redubbing of the audio turned the serious scene into a comedy.
meanings.sent4: Redubbing the dialogue breathed new life into the old recording.
meanings.sent5: The redubbing process brought a fresh perspective to the original video.
